title: cmd/5g: do not take address of array in index expression
body:
type TI [3]uintptr

func G() (t TI) {
	t[0] = 1
	t[1] = 2
	t[2] = 3
	return
}

The code generated by 5g takes the address of t to compute the address of t[0], t[1],
t[2], instead of storing directly into the stack words. This makes t not registerize
(even after the fix from CL 102890046).
